summary: This document is a list of particulars, likely from a defense motion or request for a bill of particulars, seeking detailed information from the prosecution regarding the allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell in the superseding indictment. It requests specific dates, locations, descriptions of conduct, and identities related to the alleged grooming and abuse of three minor victims by Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the superseding indictment, accused of grooming minor victims for sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein, participating in abuse, and committing perjury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexually abusing the minor victims, with Maxwell allegedly facilitating the abuse.

persons.name: Minor Victim-1
persons.context: One of three minor victims identified in the superseding indictment, allegedly groomed by Maxwell and sexually abused by Epstein, including in group settings.

persons.name: Minor Victim-2
persons.context: One of three minor victims identified in the superseding indictment, allegedly groomed by Maxwell and sexually abused by Epstein, with travel to New Mexico mentioned.

persons.name: Minor Victim-3
persons.context: One of three minor victims identified in the superseding indictment, allegedly introduced to Epstein by Maxwell and subsequently abused.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired to groom and transport minors for illegal sexual activity, as charged in Counts One and Three of the superseding indictment.
Maxwell is alleged to have met, groomed, enticed to travel, and been present for/involved in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1 by Epstein.
Maxwell is alleged to have groomed Minor Victim-2 and performed an 'unsolicited massage' on her as part of the abuse scheme.
Maxwell is alleged to have introduced Minor Victim-3 to Epstein and groomed her to engage in sex acts with him.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused Minor Victim-1, including during 'group sexualized massages'.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused Minor Victim-3 during massages after being introduced by Maxwell.

events.title: Start of Conspiracies
events.description: The alleged beginning of the conspiracies charged in Count One and Count Three of the superseding indictment.

events.title: End of Conspiracies
events.description: The alleged end of the conspiracies charged in Count One and Count Three of the superseding indictment.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 allegedly traveled from Florida to New York for the purpose of sexual encounters with Epstein.

events.title: Minor Victim-2 Travel to New Mexico
events.description: Minor Victim-2 allegedly traveled across state lines to and from New Mexico.

events.title: Maxwell's Alleged Perjurious Depositions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell allegedly lied under oath in depositions, which forms the basis for perjury charges (Counts Five and Six).

keyFacts: The superseding indictment identifies three specific minor victims (Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) and alleges Ghislaine Maxwell groomed them for sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.
The alleged criminal conspiracy period is specified as 1994 to 1997, involving interstate travel of minors for illegal sexual activity.
The prosecution alleges specific types of abusive conduct, including 'group sexualized massages' and 'group sexualized encounters' involving Epstein, Maxwell, and the victims.
Maxwell faces separate perjury charges (Counts Five and Six) related to allegedly false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions.

The defense is seeking highly specific details from the prosecution, including exact dates, locations, descriptions of illegal acts, and the identities of other participants in the alleged conspiracies.
